title: Protocol Conformity Suppression
description: Detects when information is excluded or dismissed solely because it doesnâ€™t conform to a specific protocol label or stamp, rather than due to its actual content or relevance.
indicators: Data or input rejected for missing non-content labels (e.g., date stamp, specific tag)
Information treated as irrelevant based on formal protocol non-conformance rather than content value
Patterns of exclusion tied to administrative or bureaucratic labeling rather than substantive review
